title: Dawn French webchat â as it happened | Books | The Guardian
summary: 'i do n't watch my old shows generally , but surprisingly my kids often find sketches online and show them to me '
'if i 'd never met jennifer saunders ? i 'd probably be in jail '
dawn french is with us now !
post your questions for dawn french .

documents.title: that 's it for today !
text: guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:33pm ok , looks like we 're finished , so please remember to read my book , according to yes ( out tomorrow ) , and feel free to come and see me in 30 million minutes ( vaudeville theatre , from 11 november ) , but only if you want to enjoy yourself apologies for those i did n't get a chance to answer - nothing personal , it 's just i do n't like you !
no seriously , i 'm off , i have an appointment with the one show .
cheerio !
osghde asks : best book on your bedside table over the last 6 months ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:30pm on my bedside table , as yet unread , is emma kennedy 's shoes for anthony .
ca n't wait to start it .
osghde asks : what is your muse anyway ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:29pm i endeavour every day to make my dog laugh .
so i guess it 's her , dolly .
full name : dolly the dog .
osghde asks : favorite room to write in ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:28pm my office , in my house in cornwall .
sorry to sound smug but it looks out to sea heaven .
stefanie clayton asks : which do you prefer , writing your own novels , stand-up or appearing on great tv like the vicar of dibley ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:27pm ca n't answer , as all of those things are a delight !
geordiedancer asks : hi dawn , you 've been my hero since i was a kid !
what 's the best bit of advice you 've ever been given ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:27pm my mum always said , a ) we do n't do perfect , and b ) the only way out is through .
natspink asks : hi dawn , you are on my dream dinner guest list alongside meryl streep and the queen .
who would be on yours ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:24pm i 'd like kenneth williams , richard pryor and jimmie krankie !
joseph ingram asks : congratulations on becoming chancellor of falmouth university !
what advice do you have for aspiring students who are planning their first pub crawl ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:23pm eat pasties first !

documents.title: 'if i 'd never met jennifer saunders ? i 'd probably be in jail '
text: paprikasundae asks : what would you be doing now if you 'd never met jennifer saunders ?
also , what is your spirit animal ?
much love .
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:23pm i 'd probably be in jail .
my spirit animal is a sloth .
lindon asks : what is your all-time favourite french & saunders sketch ?
lucky bitches or silence of the lambs , it must be , right¦ ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:22pm certainly lucky bitches ranks up there .
i 've thought of it a lot in the last weeks since jackie collins died , bless her .
louiseawesomebunn asks : i was just wondering , what impact do you think being a female comedian/ comedienne has had on your career as comedy is notoriously hard for female comedians to get into ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:22pm difficult .
all i know is that when jennifer and i started out there were hardly any other women .
in a way , this was to our advantage .
now , thankfully , there are many more , including jennifer 's own daughter , so it 's clear that many more young women are regarding it as a potential career .
hooray !
but it 's still not enough .
c'mon girls , step up to stand up !
adale robertson asks : as an actress , writer and radio broadcaster i 've always admired your work .
your thought for the day was wonderful , especially as geraldine granger should - in my mind be made archbishop , but if you were to offer that message as dawn what would you focus on ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:20pm i agree with you , that geraldine granger should be a bishop at the very least .
what a good idea !

as for my thought for the day , i would focus on this : a poem i read last year by jane hershfield : i moved my chair into sun i sat in the sun the way hunger is moved when called fasting what a potent little poem .
i have taken it to mean that you can change your mindset about anything in your life , so that would be it .
watsonmolly asks : i wanted to say that i very much enjoyed dear fatty , and i thought liza tarbuck did a fantastic job of the audio book .
i also wanted to thank you for your clothing line , it made me feel a little better about myself .
if it is n't too personal i wondered if you would mind sharing how long it took you to come to the decision to adopt billy ?
my husband and i are struggling with infertility at the moment and adoption is starting to pop into our consciousness .
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:16pm so glad you enjoyed dear fatty .
you 're right , liza did a great job of the audiobook .
i asked her to read it for me because some parts of the book were too painful for me to read aloud .
so i 'm eternally grateful to her for handling it all so sensitively .
liza is in my top 5 women in the world .
also glad that you liked the clothes from 1647 , which is my clothing line with my partner helen teague .
i ca n't believe it 's still hard to find a good pair of trousers if you 're a bit bigger than a size 0 , it 's so bafflingly stupid .
we decided to make the trousers a bit bigger so that curvy girls can get dressed and get on with their lives .
medusa2448 asks : if you could time-travel back to a specific time when would it be and what would you be doing in that time ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:13pm prehistoric times : i would be punching dinosaurs and eating grass wearing cow hide bras and feeling mighty !
pierregn asks : chã¨re dawn , being french , can you tell us a french joke ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:11pm non , desolee .
madworld says : jennifer and yourself were on some of the funniest series on tv at the time why is it that comedy now is so poor in comparison - what is missing ?
i remember really laughing out loud eg sex with a television begging for it classic .
please do n't say it 's me getting old the other members of the forum will do that for you .
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:11pm i would n't call present day comedy poor , just different .
believe me , there was plenty of bad comedy around when we were younger as well .
the good thing is that the cream always rises to the top .
i wonder who will be the keepers from this present crop personally i love josie long , jayde adams , birthday girls

documents.title: 'i do n't watch my old shows generally , but surprisingly my kids often find sketches online and show them to me '
text: sackdacrenow asks : do you ever watch old french & saunders shows ?
do you think they 're still as funny as they seemed at the time ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:09pm no i do n't watch them generally , but surprisingly my kids often find sketches online and show them to me , so i have seen a few recently .
blimey i 've had some appalling haircuts in my time !
id5473210 asks : when you 're not writing , what kind of novels do you seek out , and do you have a favourite literary ( or just fictional ) character ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:06pm this is an exciting question , because i purposely do n't read any fiction when i 'm writing for fear of any magpie behaviour .
now that i have finished my book ( according to yes ) i am free to up a novel , yay !
i 'm starting with h is for hawk , which my uncle ( dr michael o'brien , who my book is dedicated to and who sadly died this year ) gave me .
favourite fictional character is of course the very complicated tigger - what a guy !
steveine1 asks : if you were given the 30 million minutes again , what would you do differently ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:03pm i would worry less , and i would insist on being taller !
clarepetal asks : you 're great .
my question is who would you like to play you in a film ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:02pm no question about it , my doppelganger , jimmy krankie , of course !
dennisn10 asks : what did it feel like falling into that hole as the vicar of dibley ?

guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:01pm luckily for me , the water was quite warm - it could n't be too warm , because then it would steam , since we shot it in december and it was freezing .
it was an absolute adrenalin rush to jump in there and i could only do it once .
here 's a little secret i had a small secret wee , but do n't tell anyone !

documents.title: oops
text: guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 1:00pm by the way , who the cock is dawnfrench1 if i 'm dawnfrench2 ? !
i want to meet her/him immediately so i can bite them !
texavery asks : were you ever asked to work with the blackadder team ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:57pm no and i 'm still furious !
mark delves asks : i saw your one woman show twice and it was remarkable both times .
any plans to return to the stage in the future ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:56pm thanks for that .
i am bringing that show ( 30 million minutes ) to the west end in november , for a month .
i ca n't do it longer than that , because half way through december the set has to go on a ship to australia and then to new zealand !
i will be following soon after christmas .
objective2015 asks : what do you want in life ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:54pm pasties .
kmansley asks : dawn i always loved the music parodies you and jennifer did , the madonna and britney one being utterly hysterical .
you were also brilliant as sonia ( what 's your favourite drink ?
erm the mersey ! )
but i 'd like to ask if after your appearance in the experiment iv video , did you ever considered doing a kate bush parody ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:53pm there is nothing to parody with kate bush , since everything she does is genius .
hang on a minute , where 's my pink leotard
jlucas86 asks : i really enjoyed roger and val have just got in .
is dramatic acting something you 'd like to do more of ?
also , there are n't enough hours in my life for this much mincing ( from let them eat cake ) is a line i quote on a regular basis , so thanks for that .
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:52pm ah good a discerning viewer !
i 'm so glad you enjoyed roger and val , it 's one of my favourite work memories .
the twins who wrote it ( beth and emma kilcoyne ) are currently writing my first novel , a tiny bit marvellous , for tv , and they are tip top , so watch this space .
in answer to your question about dramatic acting , yes i would like to do more of it .
and perhaps next year i will ( what a tease i am ! )
skytale writer asks : hi ms. french : could you talk a little about the inspiration for your new book : what was the initial spark , favorite character , the like ?
what is your writing process for completing a novel-do you have a schedule for writing ; favorite place to write ?
how did you get started with writing ?
what was your early inspiration , a moment that you can point to as the starting point ?
what knowledge of the business can you impart for new writers , getting their work out/published ?
word to live by ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:51pm blimey , lots of questions !
let me answer a couple of them , otherwise it 's going to be next tuesday all of a sudden .
the inspiration for my new novel , according to yes ( out tomorrow ) , was a student exchange program i went on , age 18 , where i ended up living in manhattan for a year .
i ran out of money very quickly ( all spent on pizza ! )
so i had to get a job to support myself ; i had no qualifications , so i ended up babysitting a lot .
funny how people will give you the keys to their apartment and the charge of their children when you are very inexperienced and highly untrained , is n't it .
any road up , it placed me right in the middle of various families so i heard and saw many things an 18 year old should n't !
and that gave me the idea to write a character who is plunged into the centre of a dysfunctional family .
( i hasten to add , the families i lived with were lovely ! )
mordecaii asks : hello dawn , can you tell me anything about an adaptation of beryl bainbridge 's novel the bottle factory outing ' i heard about that you and jennifer were in ?
it 's one of my favourite novels and you would have both been perfect as freda and brenda did it actually get made ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:47pm i 'm so glad you love that novel ; me too .
as i remember it ( it 's a long time ago and i have had the menopause since ) we tried to option that novel to film , but it came to nothing .
i 'm glad you 've reminded me of it because a ) i want to read it again , and b ) maybe we could still make something of it ?
ca n't remember how old the characters are , we might be too ancient to play them now
id4183460 says : hi dawn .
thought you looked radiant on graham norton .
i 'm wondering how important living in cornwall is for your creative ventures ?
could you write as freely living in a city ?
good luck with the book !
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:45pm thank you very much for the flattery !
i accept it all .
i wrote my autobiography sitting in a room in a city , but i have written all of my novels in my house in cornwall .
it just so happens that daphne du maurier wrote some of her work in a cottage 200 yards from my house , so maybe i 'm channelling her ?
if only !
i definitely prefer writing at home , because i can walk my dog , raid my fridge and see my kids every day .
there 's something about the air in cornwall , it 's full of salt - maybe that helps ?

documents.title: here 's a of dawn
text: right before she started answering .
goosefliesatnight asks : i saw your 30 million minutes show last year and thought it was great , however - please tell us if you are planning to work with jennifer again ?
are you going to be in the ab fab film or the lovely radio 2 shows again .
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:43pm thank you for your nice words about the show .
of course i would love to work with jennifer again , it 's just a matter of thinking up the right project and finding the actual minutes to write/make it .
i am on the reserve bench for the ab fab film and will basically do anything jennifer needs me to do .
she has twice written me a character which she has immediately cut , due to finances !
she also asked me to play a character on a day when i am live on stage in liverpool , so impossible .
no radio plan for this year , but everyone talking about it next year .
i hope we do , because we love it !
ethan sills cleary asks : i am an atheist , but the vicar of dibley is one of my favourite comedies of all time .
i was wondering if you get that reaction a lot and why you think it appeals to non-religious folk .
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:39pm when richard curtis first wrote the vicar of dibley , he definitely had an agenda to normalise the idea of women priests .
however , all religion aside the show is really about a group of people so i think that 's why it appeals to non religious folk .
geraldine is simply a central focus for a lot of bonkers people to relate to .

when richard first asked me to play this character i could n't understand how she would be funny ; i thought she was a bit too good to be true , but actually of course when you 're surrounded by weirdos you can react and that 's where the comedy was .
the characters are a family , really , so i regarded it as a family sitcom where i played , kind of , the mother .
readable asks : hi dawn !
do any of your existing characters walk into new scenes when you are writing them , or are you able to keep the story lines and worlds completely separate ?
guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:36pm at the moment , i am mainly writing novels , so all the characters are new people i am inventing .
it would be a bit weird if a character from french and saunders arrived into a scene in a novel !
is that what you mean ?
and if it is , i think no !

documents.title: dawn french is with us now !
text: guardian contributor dawnfrench2 21 october 2015 12:35pm hello !
dawn here , i 'm apparently live .
i most certainly am alive !
i 'm eating a prawn sandwich and so someone else called charlotte is typing this for me here we go !
let 's get cracking !

documents.title: post your questions for dawn french
text: somewhere between her double act with jennifer saunders , her host of successful comedy dramas , and her bestselling novels and autobiography , dawn french has achieved national treasure status .
in french and saunders , she took alternative comedy into the mainstream .
with the vicar of dibley she turned gentle teatime humour into something more biting .
other series such as murder most horrid and roger & val have just got in have massed cults of their own , and she has even cropped up in the harry potter and narnia franchises .

her first two novels have sold well over a million copies between them , and her third , according to yes , is published this month ; she also takes her michael grandage-directed stage show , 30 million minutes , to the west end in november .
ahead of each , she 's joining us for a live webchat to answer your questions , from 12.30pm onwards on wednesday 21 october .
post yours in the comments below , and she 'll take on as many as possible .

bulletin.text: The comedy star is back with new novel According to Yes, and she joined us to answer your questions in a live webchat. Catch up with her answers here, from her artistic partnership with Jennifer Saunders to the best advice she's ever been given and the book on her bedside table.
